trails.name: Torres del Paine W Trek
trails.description: The classic W Trek through Torres del Paine National Park, featuring iconic granite towers, glacial lakes, and diverse wildlife. This challenging multi-day trek rewards hikers with some of Patagonia's most spectacular scenery.

trails.name: Fitz Roy Circuit
trails.description: A demanding trek around the dramatic Fitz Roy massif in Los Glaciares National Park. Experience close-up views of jagged peaks, pristine lakes, and the famous Laguna de los Tres.

trails.name: Perito Moreno Glacier Walk
trails.description: An accessible day hike offering stunning views of the famous Perito Moreno Glacier. Perfect for families and beginners, with well-maintained walkways and incredible photo opportunities.

trails.name: Cerro Castillo Circuit
trails.description: A hidden gem featuring dramatic spires, turquoise lakes, and ancient forests. This challenging circuit offers solitude and pristine wilderness away from the crowds.

trails.name: Dientes de Navarino
trails.description: The world's southernmost trekking circuit on Navarino Island. Experience the raw beauty of Tierra del Fuego with challenging weather and unforgettable landscapes.

trails.name: Huemul Circuit
trails.description: A challenging high-altitude trek featuring glaciers, alpine lakes, and stunning mountain views. Known for its technical sections and rewarding panoramas.

trails.name: Laguna Esmeralda
trails.description: A moderate day hike through forests and wetlands to a beautiful emerald lake. Perfect for those seeking a shorter adventure with stunning rewards.

trails.name: Glacier Martial
trails.description: An accessible trail near Ushuaia offering panoramic views of the Beagle Channel and surrounding mountains. Great for acclimatization and sunset views.

trails.name: Paso de los Cuervos
trails.description: A moderate trek through ancient lenga forests leading to spectacular viewpoints of the Fitz Roy range. Perfect for photography enthusiasts.

trails.name: Valle Frances
trails.description: The heart of the Torres del Paine W Trek, featuring a dramatic valley surrounded by towering granite spires and hanging glaciers.

trails.name: Sendero Costero
trails.description: A scenic coastal trail along the Beagle Channel offering marine wildlife viewing and historical sites. Suitable for all fitness levels.

trails.name: Mirador Las Torres
trails.description: The iconic day hike to the base of Torres del Paine's famous granite towers. A challenging but rewarding trek with spectacular sunrise views.

trails.name: Cerro Guanaco
trails.description: A challenging summit hike offering 360-degree views of the Patagonian steppe and Andes. Perfect for experienced hikers seeking solitude.

trails.name: Laguna Torre
trails.description: A moderate day hike to a glacial lake with stunning views of Cerro Torre. Features well-marked trails and interpretive signs about glacial geology.

trails.name: Peninsula Valdes Wildlife Trek
trails.description: A unique coastal walking experience focusing on marine wildlife observation. Best known for whale watching and penguin colonies during breeding season.

recent_updates.title: Torres del Paine Access Update
recent_updates.content: The Catamaran service to Grey Glacier is now operational for the 2025 season. Advance booking recommended due to high demand.

recent_updates.title: El Chaltén Weather Advisory
recent_updates.content: Strong winds expected this weekend. Hikers planning Fitz Roy circuit should consider postponing or bringing extra wind protection gear.

recent_updates.title: New Trail Opening: Cerro Castillo
recent_updates.content: The full Cerro Castillo circuit is now accessible after winter maintenance. Trail conditions are excellent with clear weather windows.

recent_updates.title: Permit Requirements Updated
recent_updates.content: Torres del Paine now requires online camping permits for all backcountry sites. Book at least 2 weeks in advance during peak season.

recent_updates.title: Wildlife Alert: Penguin Season
recent_updates.content: Peninsula Valdés penguin colonies are at peak activity. Best viewing times are early morning and late afternoon. Maintain 5-meter distance.
